intro: Blepharipappus scaber var. laevis, commonly known as the smoothleaf blepharipappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are smooth and often covered in a fine, silky hair, which distinguishes it from other varieties. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
